msItem.author: Sopater
msItem.title: Prolegomena in Aristidem (TLG 2031.003)
msItem.note: Where manuscript readings differ from Dindorf's and Lenz' editions, they seem to relate most closely to manuscripts A, M, p, and r in Lenz' apparatus (Vat. 1899; Marc. 423; Vat. Pal. 90; Vat. 1298).

msItem.title: Scholia in Aelium Aristidem, scholia vetera (TLG 5008.001)

msItem.explicit: ἐκ δὲ τοῦ ἐστὶ τὸ ἔτι αὐτὸν κρατεῖν

msItem.title: Παναθηναϊκός (TLG 0284.013)

msItem.note: One leaf has gone missing between f. 8 and f. 9, creating a lacuna equalling ed. Lenz 16, 10 – 18, 5. Likewise there is a leaf missing between f. 21 and f. 22 (ed. Lenz 43, 6 – 45, 16).

bibl.title: P. Aelii Aristidis Smyrnaei qvae supersunt omnia

msItem.quote: Ὁ γενεθλιακὸς οὗτος ὑπεβλήθη πρὸ μιᾶς τοῦ ἀναγνωσθῆναι ἐν τῇ καθέδρᾳ τῇ ἐπὶ γάμῳ (sic)· αὐτοῦ ὄντος ἔτων κθʹ· λύσις δὲ ἀνήδονος εἰ καὶ πάνυ δοχεῖ.

bibl.title: P. Aelii Aristidis Smyrnaei qvae supersunt omnia

msItem.quote: Ὑπὲρ τῆς πρὸς Ἀθηναίους εἰρήνης· πλεῖστα ἐν ὀλίγοις ἔχει ὁ λόγος καὶ τὰ πάθη λανθάνοντα καὶ πρέποντα ἀνδρὶ Σπαρτιάτῃ καὶ ὡς ἂν μάλιστ’ ἤνυσεν.

msItem.title: Ὑπὲρ τῆς πρὸς Ἀθηναίους εἰρήνης
msItem.note: Due to the loss of leaves, only the first twelve lines of this text are preserved.

msItem.title: Scholia in Aelium Aristidem, scholia vetera (TLG 5008.001)
Πρὸς Πλάτωνα ὑπὲρ τῶν τεττάρων. (TLG 0284.046)
msItem.note: The main text is preceded by scholia on f. 47v–48r:21. Scholia are also inserted at other places, sometimes in-between paragraphs, sometimes in a separate column on the page or else in the margins along with the main text.
One leaf is missing after f. 51 with resulting textual loss.
One leaf is missing after f. 59 with resulting textual loss.
After f. 64 several leaves have been lost.
On f. 83v:26 we find yet another rubric, although this is just part of the main text:
One leaf is missing after f. 88 with resulting textual loss.

msItem.incipit: πολέμιοι ὦ πάλαι τε δὴ καὶ νῦν

msItem.finalRubric: Ἐλευσίνιος ἐγράφη ὅσον ἐν ὥρᾳ ἐν Σμύρνῃ μηνὶ ιβʹ ἐπὶ ἡγεμόνος Μακρίνου ἔτων ὄντι ΝΓʹ καὶ μηνῶν ἕξ· ἐλέχθη δὲ ἐν τῷ βουλευτηρίῳ.

Θεῶν Διάλογοι (TLG 0062.068)
msItem.note: The end of the last dialogue, n:o 18, is lacking.

msItem.title: Scholia in Lucianum; 77, prol. (TLG 5029.001)
msItem.quote: Ἐν τούτοις τοῖς διαλόγοις διαπαίξειν βούλεται τὰ παρὰ τῶν ἀθέων Ἑλλήνων περὶ τοῦ Ἅιδου λεγόμενα καὶ διὰ τοῦτο νεκροὺς εἰσάγει ἔνθεν καὶ νεκρικοὺς τοὺς διαλόγους ὠνόμασεν.

msItem.rubric: Μενίππου καὶ Αἰακοῦ λόγος Ϛ ʹ

foliation.p: Older foliation with Greek numerals in the upper right corner of every recto page. Modern foliation in Roman numerals in the same place; the Roman numbering differs from the Greek after f. ξδʹ (number ξεʹ was skipped). From f. 10v and f. 11r every tenth leaf is numbered in Greek in the lower margin, but these numbers should not be taken as quire numbering. Original quire numbers remain on f. 88v (ιαʹ), f. 144v (αʹ), and f. 176v (Ϛʹ).

collation.p: Due to severe restauration with trimmed leaves and new glued-on guards, it is not possible to accomplish a collation. It is obvious that ff. 177, 178 and 180 are now in the wrong place and should actually have come before f. 28. Likewise, f. 125 should be placed after f. 131, and f. 191 belongs before f. 145. Furthermore, the overall order of the texts has probably undergone changes at rebinding, since according to the writer's note on f. 161 that leaf was once the last leaf of the book.

condition.p: The manuscript has been restored extensively. Each leaf was given a new guard and sometimes also new margins, but many leaves were lost prior to that radical rescue operation. Indications as to where these lacunae appear are found within the description of contents.
